channel.title: Computer
channel.description: umm in my task manager my computa says CPU usage 100%.. and goes down to 97 then back to 100... ive had it running all day... with no fan.. is that bad.... and its getting hot....

item.title: Computer
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

If someone who doesn’t or hasn’t used Eclipse before, there VM Arguments would be blank, so your going to add that in.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

m1lkman:

You have to go to run > run configurations > Java Application > Choose Project and Main Class (Server.java) > Click “Arguments” tab > In VM Arguments add “-Xmx512m” > Apply > Run

Why would you change the heap size?

Read full topic

item.title: Computer
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

You have to go to run > run configurations > Java Application > Choose Project and Main Class (Server.java) > Click “Arguments” tab > In VM Arguments add “-Xmx512m” > Apply > Run

item.title: Computer
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:23, topic:408502”][quote author=ExtremeX-Scape™ link=topic=509785.msg3701023#msg3701023 date=1312749721]

Eclipse is a memory hog!

there’s this thing called notepad++ ;D

N++ suck’s for ‘big’ project’s, I only use N++ for basic editing and all that.
Eclipse for everything else.

Dude, make a tutorial on how the f to use Eclipse, i get stuck at opening the file =.=

…

File > Open File

oh i meant a project wtf.

…

file > new > Java project

Figured I might as well be ‘specific’
[/quote]
Now how do I open the project to run it or put my files in there o.o?[/quote]

Import > Existing File System

Is that what you’re talking about?

Read full topic

item.title: Computer
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:12, topic:408502”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=509785.msg3699426#msg3699426 date=1312656011]
I fixed an overheating problem in my laptop, the fan was tangle with cat hair and it let off an awful odor while almost rendering the fan useless, so I popped it opened and pulled all the cat hair out.
[/quote]
That’s why I never set my laptop against a surface other than say a desk or a flat board of some sort. That way it doesn’t pull lint and such out of the surface it is lying on.[/quote]

It was previously my sisters, and she let the cat sleep on it every night. >.>

Read full topic

I fixed an overheating problem in my laptop, the fan was tangle with cat hair and it let off an awful odor while almost rendering the fan useless, so I popped it opened and pulled all the cat hair out.

item.title: Computer
item.dc:creator: @mcbeans mcbeans
item.description:
@mcbeans wrote:

i had a laptop like that tended to overheat alot with high cpu usage., i tried to repair it myself but it actually melted the metal to the case and i broke it trying to get through to the cpu itself. Also dont even try to repair the overheating problem yourself you’ll need an expert to do that. were you using an hp? also how much ram do you have?

Read full topic

item.title: Computer
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Go to the processes tab in the task manager and filter by CPU by pressing the CPU header. From there you can see which processes are eating your CPU most in order, could possibly be an anti virus running at high priority.

Read full topic
